## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been looking into the Verus-Ethereum Bridge, and I was wondering, what types of conversions are supported by it?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus-Ethereum Bridge supports conversions between VRSC, ETH (vETH), DAI (DAI.vETH), and MKR (MKR.vETH) in any direction (on/to Verus and Ethereum), as well as conversions to and from the Bridge.vETH currency. Do you have any other questions about the bridge or its functionality?

**User:**
That's helpful to know. Let's say I want to launch a new currency on Verus that is equivalent to an ERC-20 token. How can I do that?

**AI Assistant:**
You can launch a new currency on Verus that is 1:1 mapped to any ERC-20 token by following the process outlined in the Verus documentation. This allows you to create a new currency on Verus that is pegged to the value of an existing ERC-20 token. Would you like me to point you to the relevant documentation or provide more information on the process?

**User:**
Okay, got it. And what if I want to export a currency from Verus to Ethereum? Is that possible, and if so, how?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, you can export a launched currency (simple tokens, basket currencies) from Verus to Ethereum as an ERC-20 token. This process is explained in the Verus documentation. I can provide more information on the steps involved if you'd like.

**User:**
I've seen mention of the Bridge.vETH currency. What's the purpose of that?

**AI Assistant:**
The Bridge.vETH currency is a 100% backed currency with reserves in VRSC, ETH, DAI, and MKR. Its purpose is to simplify the bridging of assets between Verus and Ethereum by seamlessly converting fees. It's an important component of the Verus-Ethereum Bridge, making it easier to move assets between the two platforms.

**User:**
Lastly, what makes the Verus-Ethereum Bridge secure?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus-Ethereum Bridge is secure because assets are never in anyone's custody. Instead, the bridge relies on the cooperation between block producers (worldwide miners and stakers), community notary witnesses, the Bridgekeeper software, and the Ethereum smart contract to verify and prove assets at each step of cross-chain transactions. This decentralized approach, combined with consensus rules and safeguards, prevents hacks and ensures the security of the bridge.

What types of conversions are supported by the Verus-Ethereum Bridge?

The Verus-Ethereum Bridge supports conversions between VRSC, ETH (vETH), DAI (DAI.vETH), and MKR (MKR.vETH) in any direction (on/to Verus and Ethereum), as well as conversions to and from the Bridge.vETH currency.

| What       |     Details      |
| :------------------ | :----------------------------------------- |
| **Conversions**| Convert VRSC, ETH (vETH), DAI (DAI.vETH) & MKR (MKR.vETH) with each other into any direction (on/to Verus & Ethereum), or to and from the Bridge.vETH currency.|
| **Launch mapped currencies**| Launch currencies on Verus that are 1:1 mapped to any ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/mapping-1:1-eth.html)|
| **Export currencies as ERC-20**| Export any launched currency (simple tokens, basket currencies) on Verus as an ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/export-to-eth.html)|
| **Cross-chain sends**| Send any tokens, basket currencies (e.g. liquidity pools), mapped currencies etc. that are exported to Ethereum across the bridge.|
| **Export tokenized ID control**| Export a tokenized VerusID to Ethereum as ERC-721.|
| **Map VerusID to Ethereum NFT**| Launch a tokenized ID with a mapping of an Ethereum ERC-721 or ERC-1155.|Then there is the bridge currency Bridge.vETH, a 100% backed currency with 4 currencies in its reserves (VRSC, ETH, DAI, MKR). The Bridge.vETH currency function is to make the bridging of assets simple. From wherever you send it converts the fees that you need seamlessly. [More on Bridge.vETH below.](/eth-bridge/#bridge-veth-currency)## What makes the Verus-Ethereum Bridge secure
The Verus-Ethereum Bridge is different because the assets are never in anyone’s custody. This is done through the seamless cooperation between the block producers (worldwide miners and stakers), community notary witnesses, [the Bridgekeeper software](https://github.com/VerusCoin/Verusbridgekeeper) and the [Ethereum smart contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63). At each step during cross-chain transactions the assets are verified and proven by consensus rules, with safeguards in place to prevent hacks.
./raw_text_input_docs/README_eth-bridge.md
How can I launch a new currency on Verus that is equivalent to an ERC-20 token?

You can launch a new currency on Verus that is 1:1 mapped to any ERC-20 token by following the process outlined in the Verus documentation. This allows you to create a new currency on Verus that is pegged to the value of an existing ERC-20 token.

| What       |     Details      |
| :------------------ | :----------------------------------------- |
| **Conversions**| Convert VRSC, ETH (vETH), DAI (DAI.vETH) & MKR (MKR.vETH) with each other into any direction (on/to Verus & Ethereum), or to and from the Bridge.vETH currency.|
| **Launch mapped currencies**| Launch currencies on Verus that are 1:1 mapped to any ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/mapping-1:1-eth.html)|
| **Export currencies as ERC-20**| Export any launched currency (simple tokens, basket currencies) on Verus as an ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/export-to-eth.html)|
| **Cross-chain sends**| Send any tokens, basket currencies (e.g. liquidity pools), mapped currencies etc. that are exported to Ethereum across the bridge.|
| **Export tokenized ID control**| Export a tokenized VerusID to Ethereum as ERC-721.|
| **Map VerusID to Ethereum NFT**| Launch a tokenized ID with a mapping of an Ethereum ERC-721 or ERC-1155.|Then there is the bridge currency Bridge.vETH, a 100% backed currency with 4 currencies in its reserves (VRSC, ETH, DAI, MKR). The Bridge.vETH currency function is to make the bridging of assets simple. From wherever you send it converts the fees that you need seamlessly. [More on Bridge.vETH below.](/eth-bridge/#bridge-veth-currency)## What makes the Verus-Ethereum Bridge secure
The Verus-Ethereum Bridge is different because the assets are never in anyone’s custody. This is done through the seamless cooperation between the block producers (worldwide miners and stakers), community notary witnesses, [the Bridgekeeper software](https://github.com/VerusCoin/Verusbridgekeeper) and the [Ethereum smart contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63). At each step during cross-chain transactions the assets are verified and proven by consensus rules, with safeguards in place to prevent hacks.

Can I export a currency from Verus to Ethereum, and if so, how?
Yes, you can export a launched currency (simple tokens, basket currencies) from Verus to Ethereum as an ERC-20 token. This process is explained in the Verus documentation.

| What       |     Details      |
| :------------------ | :----------------------------------------- |
| **Conversions**| Convert VRSC, ETH (vETH), DAI (DAI.vETH) & MKR (MKR.vETH) with each other into any direction (on/to Verus & Ethereum), or to and from the Bridge.vETH currency.|
| **Launch mapped currencies**| Launch currencies on Verus that are 1:1 mapped to any ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/mapping-1:1-eth.html)|
| **Export currencies as ERC-20**| Export any launched currency (simple tokens, basket currencies) on Verus as an ERC-20. [Learn how](/currencies/export-to-eth.html)|
| **Cross-chain sends**| Send any tokens, basket currencies (e.g. liquidity pools), mapped currencies etc. that are exported to Ethereum across the bridge.|
| **Export tokenized ID control**| Export a tokenized VerusID to Ethereum as ERC-721.|
| **Map VerusID to Ethereum NFT**| Launch a tokenized ID with a mapping of an Ethereum ERC-721 or ERC-1155.|Then there is the bridge currency Bridge.vETH, a 100% backed currency with 4 currencies in its reserves (VRSC, ETH, DAI, MKR). The Bridge.vETH currency function is to make the bridging of assets simple. From wherever you send it converts the fees that you need seamlessly. [More on Bridge.vETH below.](/eth-bridge/#bridge-veth-currency)## What makes the Verus-Ethereum Bridge secure
The Verus-Ethereum Bridge is different because the assets are never in anyone’s custody. This is done through the seamless cooperation between the block producers (worldwide miners and stakers), community notary witnesses, [the Bridgekeeper software](https://github.com/VerusCoin/Verusbridgekeeper) and the [Ethereum smart contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x71518580f36FeCEFfE0721F06bA4703218cD7F63). At each step during cross-chain transactions the assets are verified and proven by consensus rules, with safeguards in place to prevent hacks.
